entry.title: milanvarady/Applite
entry.summary:
User-friendly GUI macOS application for Homebrew Casks

Applite

User-friendly GUI macOS application for Homebrew Casks

Table of Contents

  1. Key Features
  2. About
  3. Screenshots
  4. Download
  5. Contact
  6. Acknowledgements
  7. License
  8. Alternatives

Key Features

  • Install, update and uninstall apps with a single click
  • Clean and simple UI designed for non-technical users
  • Free and open-source
  • Handpicked gallery of awesome apps
  • Can be used with existing brew installation

About

Applite is a free and open-source macOS application that streamlines the installation and management of third-party apps using Homebrew. The app is built using Swift and SwiftUI.

The main goal of the application is to bring the convenience of Homebrew casks to the non-technical user. So the UI was designed with simplicity and ease of use in mind.

FAQ on the official website.

Screenshots

Download

Download DMG

or

$ brew install --cask applite

Minimum OS version: macOS 13+

Contact

If you have any questions, feel free to e-mail me: milan@aerolite.dev

Or join the Official Discord Server.

Acknowledgements

  • Homebrew
  • Fuse, Kiro Risk - search result filtering
  • SwiftUI CachedAsyncImage, Lorenzo Fiamingo
  • SwiftUI-Shimmer, Vikram Kriplaney
  • SwiftUI Circular Control, Phil Zakharchenko
  • Sparkle - app updates
  • Appcasks (App Fair project) - app icons

License

Applite is licensed under the MIT License. See LICENSE for more details.

Alternatives

  • Cork
  • Cakebrew
  • App Fair
  • Brewlet
  • BrewMate

entry.title: thebarbican19/BatteryBoi
entry.summary:
A Replacement for the Battery Icon in the MacOS Menu Bar.

t Q211 za # BatteryBoi - A Battery Indicator for Winners

What

BatteryBoi is a replacement Battery Indicator for the MacOS Menu Bar.

Why

The battery icon really needed an indicator for how much time is left in terms of minutes and hours. So as a fun evening project, I @MisterMeenr made it.

How (to Install)

  1. You can install the app by downloading the latest released .DMG file. This contains an executable version of the app - you do not need to Xcode to run this.
  2. Open/mount the DMG file and drag BatteryBoi into the Applications Folder. And that's it!
  3. You can hide the default battery icon by going to System Preferences > Control Center > Battery > Show in Menu Bar

Updates

BatteryBoi does not currently have support to perform automatic updates. Please üö∂üèª follow me on Twitter or Github, or ‚≠êÔ∏è start this repo to follow for release updates.

Alternatively, you can get priority updates to your email if you become a paid contributor.

Roadmap

This is just a fun project however, with your support, I will be adding...

  • üîã Battery Replacement
  • üöÄ Login at Launch
  • üë¥üèª Support for macOS Monterey & Big Sur (v11)
  • üü° System Colour Alerts
  • ü™´ Low Power Mode Toggle (Suggested by @Crear12)
  • ‚û°Ô∏è Dynamic Width Marquee Effect
  • üá≤üáΩ Multiple Language Support
  • ‚¨áÔ∏è Sparkle Intergration
  • üö® Improved Alerts
  • üèùÔ∏è A Dynamic Island-Style Modal with Sexy Indicator
  • üìà More Stats
  • ‚öôÔ∏è App Preferences
  • üéß Bluetooth Device Support
  • ‚å®Ô∏è Custom Keyboard Shortcuts


Ideas are welcome.



Q&A

Q. Is the app GDRP compliment?
A. BatteryBoi does not collect, store, process, or transfer any personal information as defined by Article 4, Section 1 of the GDPR

Q. Does this app steal my data?
A. The app only logs installs with Enalog.

‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇThe information captured in this logging event is...

‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ - Device Architecture (Silicon or Intel)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ - MacOS Version Number
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ - System Locale (ISO Country Code)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ - Theme (Dark/Light Mode).

Q. What about Personal Data?
A. No personal data or anything that can be remotely attributed to your person is collected, stored, processed, or transferred.

Q. Did you make any other sweet sweet apps I can try?
A. Yeah, SprintDock is my masterpeice. Check it out!

Q. The estimated time does not show up. Why?
A. Estimated time until battery depletion is calculated by the System. Sometimes this information just isn't available. When it isn't, it will fall back on the Battery Percentage.

Q. Can I revert back to the old MacOS Battery Indicator?
A. Yes! Go to System Preferences > Control Center > Battery > Show in Menu Bar and toggle it on.

Q. How can I quit the App?
A. Right now, the only way to quit the app is from the Activity Monitor App.



Spare some change?

In a world where almost every app has a reoccurring fee, BatteryBoi is and will remain open-source and free for everybody! But if you want to support future development and see some of the roadmap items implemented, then consider donating via this üîê Secure Stripe Link. Any amount is appreciated.

Can't afford to pay? Don't you stress about it! You can support the project simply by sharing it with who ever has a Mac.

Thank you for your consideration.
